oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Excerpt from Ednaearle Burney Oral History Interview, 2011 February 24
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Excerpt from an oral history interview with Ednaearle Burney, conducted on February 24, 2011 by Susannah Gibbons and Jared Brennan as part of the Flood 2010 Digital History Project. The topics discussed include some of Ednaearle’s losses from the flooding and the support she received in the aftermath. Though she lost her beloved piano, her brother, also a musician, gave her a keyboard shortly after the flood.
The complete interview is in the Special Collections Division.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Burney, Ednaearle, 1936- --Interviews
